intro: Garrya laurifolia var. quichensis, commonly known as the Quiché holly, is a variant of the evergreen holly native to Mexico. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for ornamental gardening. This variety is valued for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits in native landscapes.
